description: This test checks that the proper average number of surface molecules is released by a surface concentration clamp on _both_ sides of a clamped surface region. The total area of the sampling surface is (168+184) triangles with surface  area 0.5*0.00625*0.00625 each. Thus, the total number of expected molecules at the clamped surface is 0.5*0.00625*0.00625 * (168+184) * 5000 = 34.375. NOTE: The tolerances were chosen based on experimentation.
author: Markus Dittrich <dittrich@psc.edu>
